summary: This document outlines the Know Your Customer (KYC) details for Jeffrey Epstein and associated parties, including account ownership and financial relationships with Deutsche Bank. It includes information on account types, purposes, and the individuals involved in managing Epstein's financial affairs. This document outlines the Private Wealth Management Policy Statement of Deutsche Bank, emphasizing the importance of due diligence and the establishment of business relationships with clients who meet high standards of suitability, background, and character. It includes a declaration for signers to confirm the accuracy of information and adherence to procedures related to account opening.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a current client of Deutsche Bank, seeking to open new accounts for managing his financial needs.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Paul Morris is the relationship manager handling Epstein's accounts at Deutsche Bank, having previously worked with him at JP Morgan.

persons.name: Harry Beller
persons.context: Harry Beller is listed as a related party to Epstein's accounts, serving as an accountant.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is noted as a lawyer and an authorized signer for Epstein's accounts.

connections.description: Paul Morris manages Epstein's banking relationship at Deutsche Bank.
Harry Beller serves as an accountant for Epstein.
Darren Indyke is Epstein's lawyer and an authorized signer on his accounts.

locations: Little Saint James, Saint Thomas, US Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a client of Deutsche Bank, seeking to open new accounts.
Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Epstein at Deutsche Bank.
Harry Beller is identified as Epstein's accountant.
Darren Indyke is noted as Epstein's lawyer and an authorized signer for his accounts.
The document includes KYC details for multiple accounts associated with Epstein, including Neptune LLC.
The document is a Private Wealth Management Policy Statement from Deutsche Bank.
Client Facing Professionals (CFPs) are required to establish and maintain relationships only with clients who meet high standards.
Due diligence on clients must be documented appropriately.
Signers must confirm they have no suspicions of money laundering or unethical activities by clients.
The document is marked as confidential and pertains to procedures for account opening.
